intro: Pseudochirita guangxiensis, commonly known as Guangxi pseudochirita, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
